Is this a rip of a proper retail CD or is it a compilation of 320kbps songs from multiple sources?

ID3 tags are not correct - the titles are fine but the artist tag is the same on every track. Also the track numbers are not correct. Don't bother with this torrent, wait 3 days until a proper rip comes out.

Its a rip from multiple sources, and all songs are at a rate of 320kbps. The tags will be different because of that. The track order is taken from the tracklisting on the HMV website. The tracks are all in the order listed above. Take it or leave it. I thought it would be nice to make one up before the official release, and, in my opinion, (and hopefully other people's too) it's spot on! but hey, everyone has their own opinion - so take it or leave it i guess!

If anyone else could comment if they have any issues with this (or praises of course) that would be great :) I did up a version with multiple bitrate, but i was first to admit that some of the songs weren't top notch. That's why i started afresh and did each song individually.

First off I want to thank you for the time and trouble of doing this for others. Am downloading it now, and as far as I am concerned if it fits on discs then all is good. Those that want to find fault then look in a damn mirror.
Much appreciated Horrorspoke.

I just read my comment back that I wrote a while ago, and I really sounded like an ungrateful douchebag... which is not how I wanted to come across!

My comments weren't an insult to you at all, Horrorspoke, they were more a guide for others downloading the torrent so that they knew what they were getting, since there were a couple of bits of information missing from the description. I'm quite fussy when it comes to my downloads, i.e. I like them to be from a retail CD and all be tagged properly (not that I have a problem with doing it myself), but for the majority of people this rip is great.

So, in short, thanks for the effort and the upload, even if it's not one that I would personally pick :)
